results.title: English lyrics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
The lyrics of Tennyson, Keats, Wordsworth, Shelley, Shakespeare, Browning and others are presented. Viewing such scenes as Dover Beach, Westminser Bridge, and the Shropshire country, students gain new appreciation and understanding of the work of poets.

results.title: Analysing characters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Literature Appreciation”.
Literary characters of James Thurber, Bret Hart and Nathaniel Hawthorne some to life to explain themselves, and appear in dramatisations of famous stories. They rate themselves in terms of development and complexity, and invite judgement of their actions based on each author’s purpose in writing their story.

results.title: Listening to Music
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Trumpet, horn and trombone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Listening to Music”
The film introduces the trumpet, horn and trombone and shows in close-up the basic techniques of producing sound from the instruments. The use of the lips to produce a harmonic series is clearly demonstrated. In the case of the trumpet and the horn the use of the valve mechanism, and the slide in the case of the trombone, are also explained.

results.title: The String trio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Listening to Music”
Examines the construction, and basic techniques for playing, of the violin, viola and violoncello (cello). All three instruments are similar in construction. Shots of the violin show the body, bridge, nut and peg box; the purpose of each is explained. The violin, smallest of the three, has the shortest strings and the highest pitch; the cello with the longest strings has the deepest voice. Shows how the players make other notes besides those given by each open string. In conclusion, the trio plays Minuet from “Divertimento in E Flat” by Mozart.

results.title: Lenses
results.creator_credit: S.G. Fergusson, Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Light”.
Convex lens as a collection of prism sections; images formed by convex lens; applications of the various object/image arrangement; effect of increased curvature; concave lens; images formed by a concave lens.

results.title: Refraction
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Light”.
Considers a ray of light passing through a rectangular slab of glass, offering the analogy of wheels, running on to a bed of sand. Illustrates refraction through a prism; water to air refraction; total internal refraction; right-angled prisms; the periscope and binoculars.

results.title: Spherical mirrors
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Light”.
Explains the basic properties of convex and concave mirrors, contrasting real and virtual image formation, and illustrates practical applications.

results.title: Wave and quantum theories
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Light”.
Demonstrates the accepted theory of light as consisting of both wave motion and of discrete bundles or quanta of energy. Performs Young’s double-slit experiment to show the wave character of light. Shows in laboratory demonstrations and in animation the Compton effect and other major experiments associated with the present theory.
